About the role:
The Western Public Health Unit (WPHU) has been established to strengthen the public health response to communicable diseases and other health issues. The unit is part of a system of three metropolitan public health units and six regional units that provide a state-wide network of public health delivery and oversight.
WPHU is led and coordinated by Western Health and responsible for approximately 1.4M people in the LGAs of Maribyrnong, Moonee Valley, Hobson's Bay, Merri-bek, Melbourne, Brimbank, Melton and Wyndham. Local public health units have responsibility for management of almost all notifiable conditions under the Public Health and Wellbeing Act (2008) alongside the Department of Health (DH), as well as non-communicable disease and health promotion activities in their assigned catchments, as part of the state's overall public health response.
The Data Analyst is a member of the Data, Epidemiology and Surveillance (DES) team. The role reports to the Deputy Director, working closely with teams across the unit.

Provide data management, report development, analytical and data visualisation support to the Western Public Health Unit
Strong communication skills to train and support other staff in data management and be able to translate operational and research questions into analytic projects
Design, develop, maintain, and operate systems for automation of current WPHU processes
Develop, maintain, implement and iteratively improve automated reports using Microsoft Power BI and R to meet internal and external WPHU reporting needs
About you:
Excellent data management and problem skills, a strong eye for detail, and the ability to apply your analytical and critical thinking skills
Advanced proficiency with R, SQL, Power-BI and Microsoft Excel (including use of Power Query)

Relevant tertiary qualification in data science, analytics, or similar, or proven success in a similar role

full description:

South Eastern Melbourne Primary Health Network (SEMPHN) is seeking a skilled and passionate

Who We Are
SEMPHN is a not-for-profit organisation dedicated to creating a more person-centred, equitable and connected health system. We work across a wide range of priority areas including mental health, alcohol and other drugs, Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander health, aged care, population health, digital health, and workforce development.
By delivering planning, commissioning, and capacity-building initiatives, we aim to strengthen primary healthcare and meet the needs of our local communities. Our strategic framework,
Path to Impact
, ensures our work is grounded in evidence, aligned to community needs, and focused on delivering tangible, measurable outcomes across the health system.
About the Role
This role is pivotal in supporting SEMPHN’s health planning and commissioning through deep analysis and strategic insight. You’ll be involved in the full data lifecycle — from extracting and modelling data, to interpreting and presenting insights that inform high-level decision-making.
Key responsibilities include:
Designing and conducting population health needs assessments to identify service gaps and opportunities
Analysing health and service utilisation data to inform program development and regional planning
Developing dashboards and visualisations using tools like R, Python, and Power BI
Preparing high-quality reports and presentations tailored to a range of audiences
Collaborating with internal teams, government stakeholders, service providers, and academic institutions
Monitoring and evaluating data trends and providing timely insights to support continuous improvement
Supporting innovative use of GP practice-level data for service planning and evaluation
Triangulating qualitative and quantitative data to build compelling evidence stories
This role combines technical analysis with strategic thinking and a focus on real-world health outcomes.
About You
You are a data professional who is passionate about improving population health. You enjoy working in collaborative environments and can turn complex data into accessible, meaningful information for decision-makers.
You will bring:
A degree in public health, epidemiology, biostatistics, health sciences, data analytics or a related field
Proven experience working with health or community data to support planning, evaluation or research
Strong statistical analysis skills using R, Python, or SAS
Proficiency in data visualisation tools such as Power BI or Tableau
A solid understanding of the social determinants of health and the Australian healthcare landscape
Experience preparing and presenting clear, insightful reports to both technical and non-technical stakeholders
The ability to manage competing priorities, meet deadlines and work across multiple projects
A proactive, inquisitive mindset and the ability to think critically and innovatively
Strong interpersonal skills to collaborate with internal and external partners
Desirable attributes:
Knowledge of health economics or market analysis
Experience with GP practice-level data
Experience in government or not-for-profit health sectors

Salary packaging options to increase your take-home pay
Hybrid and flexible working arrangements to support work-life balance
Paid parental leave, carers leave and additional festive leave
Access to free employee wellbeing and support programs
A values-led, purpose-driven team culture where your work has real impact
The opportunity to help build a more connected and effective healthcare system

About Us
Join the team transforming hospital intelligence.
At HealthCare Logic, we’re empowering executive, clinical and operational teams to optimise hospitals through improved data-led decision-making and processes. As the emerging leader in hospital intelligence, our flagship platform SystemView is installed in more than 170 hospitals across Australia, Ireland, and the UK to make faster, smarter decisions that improve patient outcomes.
We’re not just building dashboards, we’re engineering clarity. Our platform leverages high-frequency, transaction-level datasets, powered by AI/ML algorithms, to deliver real-time insights that unlock capacity, improve processes and optimise patient flow.
You’ll be part of a borderless team of data engineers, scientists, product experts and customer success who are curious, accountable, and driven by impact. Together, we’re creating a globally connected network of high-performing hospitals.
If you’re passionate about data with purpose and want to see your work directly improve healthcare systems, this is your moment.
About the Role
As a Senior Data Engineer, you’ll take ownership of key projects aligned with our product roadmap, designing and maintaining robust ETL pipelines across diverse technologies. Your deep understanding of hospital operations and end-user needs will be essential as you collaborate with stakeholders to deliver smart, data-driven solutions.
You’ll drive automation, enhance data quality, and mentor engineers at all levels—all while staying ahead of emerging technologies.
Key Responsibilities
Lead the design, development, and maintenance of scalable ETL pipelines.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to deliver data solutions aligned with healthcare needs.
Develop new components for our SystemView platform.
Champion data quality and automation initiatives.
Mentor junior engineers and foster a culture of continuous learning.
Conduct rigorous testing and document technical specifications.
Support production environments and troubleshoot complex data issues.
Essential Skills & Experience
Bachelor’s or higher in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field.
5+ years in data engineering, ideally with healthcare experience.
Proficiency in SQL and Python.
Expertise in cloud platforms, especially Azure.
Experience with SQL Server Integration Services, SQL Server 2016+, and ETL tools.
Strong understanding of healthcare standards and compliance.
Proven leadership and mentoring capabilities.
Experience writing automated tests for data pipelines.
Good to Have
Experience with Azure Data Factory (ADF).
Familiarity with AWS.
Knowledge of database engines like MySQL, Postgres, and MS SQL.
Exposure to agile methodologies and tools like Scrum, CI/CD, Redgate, React, NodeJS, and Docker.
Experience with AI/ ML tools and LLMs.
Passion for delivering high-quality work and solving complex problems.
HealthCare Logic operates across multiple jurisdictions and has a mix of hybrid and remote workers. Leaders are expected to establish ways of working to reasonably accommodate time zones while maintaining staff and own engagement and wellbeing.

Join a team at the cutting edge of healthcare analytics to improve patient outcomes worldwide
Solve interesting real-world problems in a dynamic environment that make a meaningful impact
Attractive salary
Work within a global team and collaborate internationally
